title: How to Make Parchment Like Paper for Writing

steps.title: Brew a cup of strong coffee, almost black, depending on how dark you want your paper to be.
steps.content: Brew a cup of strong coffee, almost black, depending on how dark you want your paper to be.

steps.title: Take a piece of paper and crumple it.
steps.content: Take a piece of paper and crumple it.

steps.title: Dip a cotton ball in the cup of warm coffee and evenly distribute it throughout the paper.
steps.content: Dip a cotton ball in the cup of warm coffee and evenly distribute it throughout the paper.

steps.title: Let it dry using a hair drier or fan.
steps.content: Let it dry using a hair drier or fan.

steps.title: Light a candle and gently burn the sides, careful not to catch fire, as it may eat up a big part of the paper.
steps.content: Light a candle and gently burn the sides, careful not to catch fire, as it may eat up a big part of the paper. Make sure you do this far away from flammable objects.

steps.title: Put the paper in a pan and turn to medium heat, use a spoon, or chopstick and gently press down on the paper for 30 seconds, this makes the paper have small brown spots.
steps.content: Put the paper in a pan and turn to medium heat, use a spoon, or chopstick and gently press down on the paper for 30 seconds, this makes the paper have small brown spots.

steps.title: Now you've got your parchment paper like they used in the early 1400's.
steps.content: Now you've got your parchment paper like they used in the early 1400's. Use a fountain pen to write with to make the parchment look old. You can also use it to make a birthday party invitation look fancy. Tie with a leather string or old brown string to make it really resemble a scroll-like letter.
